fields.content:
Libraries are made up of spectra (spectra, collapsed spectra, and spectra XML) and metadata.

Metadata for strains in libraries can be aligned with NCBI taxonomy IDs from NCBI's Taxonomy Browser.
Registration is required in order to use certain site functionality such as basic file search and data management.

fields.long_title: Using the NCBI taxonomy search alignment tool

fields.content:
Simple search compares an unknown sample against known libraries.

Unknown samples are preprocessed to filter for prominent peaks in the spectra. Replicates in uploaded files are collapsed to produce an averaged spectra for the sample. Averaged spectra are then compared against spectra in known libraries with cosine similarity used as the similarity measurement.

To register as a new user on the site, open the "Register" link from the navigation menu and follow the steps there to create a new site account.

![](/media/register.png)

Every new user is assigned a default lab group.

Lab groups can contain zero or more spectra libraries, and are moderated by a set of owners and accessible by a set of members.

Lab groups help to organize datasets (libraries) on the site. All spectra and metadata added to the site are kept in libraries. In turn, libraries are kept in lab groups.

As a future feature, users will be able to invite other site users to join their labs, as well as request to join the labs of other users.
File upload currently works as part of the simple search.

fields.long_title: Upload an IDBac SQLite file and align metadata with NCBI's Taxonomy Browser
fields.content:
*1)* Add a new library.

From the main menu select "Add: Library" to add a new library.

![](/media/newlibrary.png)

*2)* Add a new IDBac SQLite file, or select an existing R01 dataset file.

From the main menu select "Add: IDBac SQLite".

![](/media/newsqlite.png)

Select "Upload a single IDBac SQLite file" to upload an SQLite file.

Alternatively, select "Load a single hosted IDBac R01 data file" to load one or more sample SQLite files already hosted online.

*3)* When the SQLite addition task completes, collapse the library entry's replicates.

Find the new library from the main menu under "Browse: Libraries".

![](/media/libraries.png)

Under the "Collapse replicates" column, click "collapse" to run the collapse procedure on the library's replicates.

*4)* When the collapse task is complete, open the library's detail page to align the library with NCBI's taxonomy data.

![](/media/libraries2.png)

*5)* From the "NCBI taxonomy search" tab, enter a prefix for searching against NCBI taxonomy data, or leave the prefix blank for a direct comparison.

Click "Load alignments" to perform the search.

![](/media/ncbisearch.png)

For example, a prefix of "NRRL" will match a strain titled "B-784" with NCBI's "NRRL B-784". 

![](/media/ncbisearch2.png)

Exact matches will be shown at the top of the form, while partial matches will be shown below.

Use the "Import NCBI taxonomy IDs for exact matches" button to import taxonomy data for any exact matches.

In the bottom of the form, one or more partial matches can be selected for importing.

![](/media/ncbisearch3.png)

In the case of multiple results, use the "Update ID" column to select the matching NCBI taxonomy ID of choice.

Click the "Add selected Metadata" button to import any selected partial matches.

*6)* Use the "NCBI taxonomy bulk modify" tool to quickly match a number of strains against NCBI data.

![](/media/ncbibulk.png)

Strain IDs represent metadata already added to the site. Details on which strain IDs are in the selected library can also be seen by opening the metadata link on the "Library details" page.

![](/media/ncbibulk2.png)

![](/media/ncbibulk3.png)

Again, click the "Import NCBI taxonomy IDs for exact matches" and "Add selected Metadata" buttons to import NCBI data.

![](/media/ncbibulk4.png)

fields.long_title: Upload a set of mzml or mzxml files by utilizing the Basic Search tool
fields.content:
*1)* From the main menu, open basic search ("Menu: Basic Search").

Click the "Show more options" button.

![](/media/uploads1.png)

Select the option to "Create new library" and enter a library name.

Click "Choose file(s)" and select one or more mzml or mzxml files to add to the library.

Click "Upload".

After the upload is complete, the library will be visible from the Library page of the main menu ("Browse: Libraries").

fields.long_title: Search one or more unknown samples against R01 data
fields.content:
*1)* From the main menu, open "Menu: Basic Search".

![](/media/search1.png)

Click on "Choose file(s)" to select one or more mzml or mzxml files of unknown strains to upload.

Click "Upload" to begin the search process.

![](/media/search3.png)

After the files have been uploaded, pre-processed, and matched against R01 data, top scoring R01 samples will be shown for each uploaded strain.

Clicking "Explore more" will open a "Result" tab containing more details on the matching.

![](/media/search4.png)

In the "Result" tab, click on any strain in the "Strain Name" column to view a mirror plot against the unknown sample.

A histogram details a cosine similarity scoring distribution of the library against the unknown sample with a select tool to view the distribution by taxonomic rankings.

The select tool also controls groupings on the dendrogram.

The dendrogram includes a toggle button to toggle between viewing variable and equalized match height.

Click the "Search results" tab to go back to the full list of uploaded files.

fields.long_title: Using the NCBI taxonomy bulk modify alignment tool

fields.content: Users may choose to import IDBac SQLite datasets onto the site.
